text: Last I knew you cannot trigger a webhook from a form submission.  But you could create a workflow based on a form submission and the add a webhook call.  This is only available for Market Enterprise though afaik.  I have not tried it but you might be able to use Zapier's webhook functions as well.

Hi! I have a react app with some components on it. I have to bring those components to a hubSpot project (which I have never used before). Inside my react app I am using material ui, framer motion, maplibre-gl, react-map-gl, axios, and other libraries. Can I get all the code into HubSpot ? or I am not able to do that ?

Hey <@U077K3S44KY>, our overview doc <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-overview|here> contains some more info re: your question. We don't support non-HubSpot UI libraries, and due to the nature of our renderer + security precautions, we don't allow packages that touch the DOM. Could you tell me more about your use case?

Hi <@U04EJHVD8FM>! Thank you so much for your reply. I have a very specific hero that I needed to develop. I should be interactive and match a specific map tile we created, change map with each different tab and render the info of each marker (which appears on the map), on the right hand panel. I can provide an img of the result code in react:

We allow the opening of an iframe in a modal <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-sdk#open-an-iframe-in-a-modal>. That might be better for your usecase here. That UI will be hard to re-create inside HubSpot.

If I want to get CRM associations within a custom card is the only way to use a serverless function and make an API call? Just want to make sure I am not missing anything similar to the fetchCrmObjectProperties  function
Yeah currently that’s the only way, would be pretty sick to have a graphql function similar to the fetchCrmObjectProperties function
Agreed, or at a minimum something mirroring crm_associations and crm_objects HUBL functions
I just feel a little hesitant to call an api call (maybe more then one) on every page load theoretically
Yeah it’s a little annoying but honestly I do it a good bit with no issues
